MEDD_V 412-001 - Foundations of Medical Practice II
MEDG_V 421-001 - Genetics and Cell Biology of Cancer

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
MEDG 421 is fully-registered. Workday will give you an option to add yourself to the waitlist and the system will automatically register a waitlisted student if a seat becomes available.

OPTIONAL textbook: "The Biology of Cancer" by Robert A. Weinberg (2nd Edition)
Note: A background in cell biology is assumed - a grade of B or higher in BIOL 335 is strongly recommended. The course requires extensive independent reading of scientific journal articles. If you'd like to be added to the MEDG 421 waitlist, please contact the course coordinators, Dr. Evgin at Laura.evgin@ubc.ca and Dr. Stirling at pstirling@bccrc.ca.

instances.text: MICB_V 404-201 - Topics in Molecular Bacterial Pathogenesis

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: The mode of delivery for this section is in-person.  In person attendance is required for all course activities, including examinations.  Students should register into the wait-list at the present time.  Student that are on the wait-lists for MICB 404, 406, 412 and 413 will be asked to rank their preferences for registration - please send an email to Dr. Kion after you have registered.  Depending on the demand for these courses, students may be registered in only one course (this will happen in mid-July).  If seats remain open, students may be registered into a second course.  Students should consult Workday Student on a regular basis in late July to see if they have been moved into the course. Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca.

detailResultFields.value: The mode of delivery for this section is in-person.  In person attendance is required for all course activities, including examinations. Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Students will need to have a faculty mentor from the Department of Microbiology & Immunology before registration into MICB 448B.  See the following URL for faculty that may have seats open in their laboratories.  https://www.microbiology.ubc.ca/faculty-staff/faculty. After you have a faculty mentor agree to have you work in their lab, contact Dr. Kion at tkion@mail.ubc.ca for registration into the course.  Include your student number and the name of your faculty mentor.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Applications in Synthetic Biology -  Self-directed, collaborative studies in a group-learning environment. Self-initiated and coordinated by upper-level undergraduate students with the supervision of a faculty advisor. Not suitable as an MICB course selection to meet MBIM, MBIM/CSPC or MICB/OCEA specialization requirements.

instances.text: MICB_V 471-201 - Laboratory Research in Microbiology and Immunology

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course replaces MICB 421 and MICB 447 effective 2022W.  MICB  471 is credit-excluded with MICB 421 and MICB 447.  Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Oliver, dcoliver@mail.ubc.ca.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course replaces MICB 401 effective 2022W.  MICB  475 is credit-excluded with MICB 401.  Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca. In addition to lectures students will be required to attend a weekly 45 minute meeting (scheduled during the first two weeks of classes).

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
